title: VACCINE TEAM | Will we need to get the vaccine annually like a flu shot?
body: LEXINGTON, Ky. (WKYT) - As we continue to watch vaccines roll out across Kentucky, we are here to answer your questions.The answer is: probably.. He says people are likely to need a third dose of the vaccine 6 to 12 months after their first round. From there, it will be an annual revaccination.Officials are still testing the timing of follow-up doses.We’re still waiting to hear from Moderna or Johnson and Johnson.The J&J vaccine is a vector vaccine. The other two are MRNA vaccines.Viral vector vaccines use a modified version of a different virus to deliver important instructions to our cells.MRNA vaccines are a new type. They don’t put a weakened germ into your body. They teach your cells how to make a protein that triggers an immune response.To date, the CDC says hasn’t received any reports of rare blood clots in people who received the Pfizer or Moderna vaccines.
